Opaque black color, tiny brownish head. Strong aroma of salt licorice, coffee, vanilla and roasted maltyness. Full-bodied. Vanilla, licorice, rhum, candies, alcohol, sweetness. Very, very complex and a bit weird same time. Delicious.

Poured a dark black color from the bottle with aromas of bakers fudge, light spicy peppers, some earth, vanilla and some booze. Flavors were spicy fudge dipped in rum and brandy. This is some pretty good stuff that is thick and delicious.

Big thanks to beerman6686 for bringing this one. Pours a deep dark brown black with e dark brown head. Aroma of chocolate, some coffee, the chillies are in there too. Taste is a slight alcohol burn and then the sweetness of the beer and then the pepper heat. I am loving it.

This one poured an oily black color with a tan head. Aroma was of lots of cinnamon, apple brandy, fudge, and light chile notes. Flavor was similar, everything melded together perfectly, moderate heat, cinnamon fudgy richness and barrel. Grat stuff.

At jacobs with group. Pour is black with faint lacing. Aroma is sweet complex bourbon/brandy, big delicious roasted malt, cream brule. Taste is phenomenal, complex malt, some cinnamon spice. It is hard to describe, it reminds me of rare, has a beautiful unique sweet booze note in there, so savory and so good.
Bottle shared thanks to beerman6686. Pours pitch black with super thin head. Aroma of light spice with plenty of fruit and barrel. Light light carb thick bod. Pleasant light spice and barrel.

UPDATED: JUL 21, 2014 Wow this is unbelievable. The aromas are pouring apple pie, port, vanilla, coconut and some booze. The taste has so many flavors. Cinnamon, apples, chocolate, nutmeg and there are some really tight tannins in this. Finish long with more cinnamon and nutmeg. Exceptional.

Thanks to the reverend and Prazak. Apple brandy comes out great in the aroma. So tasty. The cinnamon in 2014 comes out great in the taste. Probably one of the best beers I have ever had. Lives up to the hype.

Bottle from the brewery.
Solid inky black color with a creamy dark mocha head that slowly dissipates to wisps on top. My God that aroma is heavenly! Rich chocolate caramel and molasses with a spiced rum cake kind of feel to it. Moderate amount of cinnamon, light wood and vinous fruity notes. The flavor is rich chocolate spiced cake with hints of rum and molasses. The alcohol shows a bit of warming but is never harsh. Medium to thick body with a light to moderate level of carbonation and a slick syrupy sticky mouthfeel. Damn that is a great beer! Even the non beer geeks I shared this with enjoyed it. Wish I had more!

Okay... You know what Hunahpus look like.. Yep.. Freaking beautiful!! 
Aroma is really complex, just the way I like it. Plenty of regular huna shining through. Im always stunned how they make this so perfectly balanced, with plenty of vanilla, cacao, coffee, dark chocolate, coconut, some slightly earthy green notes, and the chilies peaking out right at the very back. Theres some apple cake/pie in here as well, and the rum barrel is adding slightly more vanilla/sweetness to it. Suits this beer marvelously for sho!! 
The taste is pretty sweet, but surely theres some bitterness in here as well to balance everything. 
You know huna is one thick chick, oily and slick, with a soft/smooth/somewhat flat carb. This my new favorite beer, and a huge shout out to Mr. BoggyChillin for sending this my way.. Hot DAMn!!!

Thanks Geoff for cracking this open! Pours a dark, iodine coating the glass, brown black with a very slight mocha tan collar. Minimal carbonation. Heavy. Aroma is spice and somewhat reminds me of a holiday beer. Dark chocolate notes as well. Medium/heavy mouthfeel. Lots going on, sweet start followed by the spice of chili and then transitions to a more earthy barrel note. 4oz was fine for me. Not sure I could drink a whole lot of this.

Bottle at tasting. Pours a thick looking dark black with no carbonation. Aroma is soft peppers, chocolate and spirits. Flavor was unbelievable. Cinnamon, spirits, chocolate. Super smooth, thick pour. Stuck to my mouth. Some peppers come through at the end. Awesome beer.

Bottle (750 ml). Shared by kermis, huge thanks! Cigar City deep black with a small dark brown head and little to no lacing. Aroma is rich and very complex with chocolate, raisins, spices, dark chocolate, perfume, chili peppers, Rum, vanilla, spices, fruity notes, cinnammon... it might even be a tad too complex and it doesnt completely get together (still really good too). The taste, on the other side, is as complex but it is perfectly integrated in a decadent burst of flavors... dark chocolate, Rum, vanilla, raisins, cinnamon, chili peppers, spices, coffee, Brandy and a perfect moderately warming lingering alcohol/spices finish. Full bodied and it stimulate all of your taste buds. Medium carbonation that is pefect to open the flavors. Spicy finish. Regular Hunahpu is one of the best beer with chili peppers, but this one is just so freaking good. You wont easily find a beer that is as complex as this one. The balance is great for this kind of beer. I really enjoyed this one!

Bottle at our Brussels beer weekend. Dark black pour with brown head. Aroma is quite perfumy, really intense raisins, cocoa, spice, cinnamon, chili peppers, rhum, like the regular but everything seems a bit more rounded. Taste is even better, lots of raisins, cocoa, nice alcohol and chili warmth without being vegetal or actually hot. Palate is full bodied, palate coating but with nice carbonation. My favorite hunahpu all night, beautiful.

Bottle. The pour is dark and think, it coats the glass heavily. The aroma is a great mix of sweet apple and booze, very inviting. The taste is amazingly good. A fantastic blend of flavors, with complex flavors. A beer that lives up to the hype.

UPDATED: JUN 18, 2014 Bottle shared at the 2014 tasting in the Cellar of Moeder Lambic Saint-Gilles. Pours near black with a ring brown head. Aroma of roast, dark chocolate, veggy chillis, caramel, fudge, coffee. Flavor is light heavy sweet and bitter. Thick mouthfeel with a strong growing chilli kick. Full bodied with soft carbonation. Awesome!

Okay then.. Puors black with the nicest head you can emagine. Perfect size and density. The smell is to die for. Hard to understand how they can pack so much chocolate, licorice, barrel (not too much though) chili, vanilla and slight booze into a beer. There is some pretty noticable coffee and coconut in here too. Its really rich this one. The mouthfeel is thick but manageable. The flavour is insane too. Its like regular Hunahs beefed up big brother with some complex barrel character on the side. Please give this time to settle in the glass, open up and reveal itself, cause if you treat Hunah just right, it could give you a craftbeer boner! Fo realz. Its dat gewd!

UPDATED: APR 16, 2015 Bottle: Huge thanks to Travis & Tommy for splitting this with me. Black, black, black & oily as fuck, topped with a velvety, fine mocha cream that lasts exceedingly long for a stout. This beer is a bowl Cinnamon Toast Crunch & Teddy Grahams covered in vanilla drizzle, fudge, & sweet Apple Brandy sauce. Chocolate, roast, sweet brandy, vanilla, cinnamon, mild coffee, graham cracker.... Only thing I dont get is the chili peppers, Im guessing the barrels have swallowed them whole. I dont mind, though, because they might interfere with the decadence of this brew. Thick, chewy, creamy; this is a very big beer on the palate. A dessert beer to the max, fantastic all around.
Update: After having this quite a few more times thanks to many generous BAs, as well as some local tasting groups, I have to bump the score up. This just gets better & better. Molten  Chips Ahoy & Teddy Graham cookies with cinnamon graham cracker, apple brandy, vanilla bean chips & dark fudge drizzle. This is truly an excellent beer.

Bottle... This beer rocks!... Pours as black as night with no head. The luxuriant, robust aroma is a melange of brownie brittle, cinnamon, graham and vanilla. Full-bodied and chewy with lazy carbonation. The flavor is a swirl of sweet caramel, fudge, chocolate creme, spiced rum, molasses and cinnamon accompanied by mild chili heat. Tobacco and burnt marshmallow in the finish with lingering chili and liquor warmth. Liquid intensity - but silky-smooth as well. Big-time thanks goes out to darkguardian for popping the top on this bottle of world class beer!

Bottle shared by TheHOFF43! Dark black pour, minimal carbonation and an aroma of mild pepper, chocolate and sweet alcohol. Flavor was outstanding meld of cinnamon sticks, apple brandy, chocolate, muddled peppers and finished slightly hot. Easily the best of the night during a tasting full of heavy hitters.
Bottle shared at LeviLOL tasting - thanks Hoff!!! Amazing nose on this. Coconut, toffee and cinnamon. Super thick mouthfeel. Among joy exploding in my mouth. Huge chocolate and sugar. Really nice!
Bomber shared by da Hoff. Super dark black oily pour. Rich in every way. Super sweet. Wood. Brandy. Goddamn this is awesome.

Bottle 750ml. @ cgarvieuk [ Lets do a chrisO Tasting ], Edinburgh, Scotland. [ As Cigar City Hunahpus Imperial Stout - Double Barrel Aged ].Clear dark brown black color with a average, creamy - frothy, fair - virtually none lacing, mostly lasting to diminishing, light brown head. Aroma is heavy malty, roasted, chocolate, moderate coffee, light wood. Flavour is heavy sweet and bitter with a long long duration, wood, chocolate, coconut, ceder notes, light alcohol - sweet alcohol. Body is medium to full, texture is creamy - syrupy, carbonation is soft, finish feel is light moderate alcoholic. Mums this is nice ;D [20140315]

UPDATED: MAY 9, 2015 Pour from bottle at What the Funk!? 2014. Appearance is dark viscous car oil with a frothy brown head. Big rich dark chocolate, huge spice - vanilla, nutmeg, and cinnamon - brandy, sweet roasted toffee, oak, and coffee. Taste is again thick and rich dark cocoa, balanced by sweet vanilla, roast, and spice. Amazingly complex - with cinnamon and spice, light chili peppers, fudge brownies, espresso, and wood. Luscious, velvety mouthfeel with soft carbonation. No real heat from the peppers except on the back-end, that rounds it out beautifully. Every time I have Hunahpu or one of its variations Im completely blown away and this beer is no exception. Delicious chocolate spice cake.

28/III/14 - 75cl bottle @ De Hopduvel (Gent) - BB: n/a (2014-318) Thanks to Bobochamp for sharing the bottle!
Very dark brown to black beer, no head. Aroma: spicy, cinnamon, lots of chocolate, dark fruits, sugary, caramel, more cinnamon. MF: ok carbon, full body. Taste: bit sourish start, chillies, very spicy, lots of cinnamon, ginger bread, speculoos, caramel, bit sweet, fruity touch, sour apples. Aftertaste: lots of chocolate, lots of cinnamon, bit sugary, sourish touch, chillies burning softly, smooth bitterness from the hops, more cinnamon. Like chocolate covered speculoos on steroids! Lovely!

75cl bottle, shared by BoBoChamp. Many thanks for all the beers shared today!
APPEARANCE: pitch black beer, no foam.
NOSE: some alcohol, faint wood, fruity, and yes, with some imagination I can even smell some apples here. Some dark chocolate here as well.
TASTE: brandy, quite fruity, yes apples again, alcohol, rather sweet.

Bottle shared with, and thanks to, the Great Damico. Bottle came as the result of some excellent reconnaissance at Hunahpus Day. Pours a dark black color with a thick chocolate head that breaks down quickly. The head retention is amazing for a barrel aged brew. Aroma of chocolate roast, dark fruit, apple, pepper, vanilla, and hints of breadiness. Really intoxicating. A sweet chocolate taste with notes of chili, vanilla, and slight cinnamon. A nice layer of heat from the pepper. Wow. It really is hard to say whether this or the base version is better. So much complexity. So much happening during the first 3 seconds on the tongue. Just another amazing brew that I likely will never be fortunate to drink again. Kudos to Redner and a big thanks to Damico.

Bottle shared at Dunts Tasting (Chicago, IL). Pours an inky thick blackish hue, midnight hues with touches of dark brown glow on the edges. Frothy dark brown head dies to a decent ring, sticks around. Aromas are firm barrel, oak and vanillin meet shaved toasty coconut, rum and brown sugar. Touches of brandy, cocoa and coffee. Firmer spirit, tannic, and warmth. Initial is firmer bodied, a bit thick with some decent warmth. Touches of of rum, vanilla and brown sugar, touches of toasted coconut. Touches of mint, spirit, and fudge. Sweeter caramel, some thickness. Backend is a bit warm, gentle chile and warmth with vanilla, roasty coffee. Keeps a good body even with the firm barrel. A bit warm, roasty, caramel, with gentle coconut, pepper and spirit. Quality stuff, perhaps a bit overbarreled on the nose but the beer itself is pretty on point. Nice.
Pours jet black with a small beige brown head leaving some lacing. Fantastic aroma and flavor just like I was expecting; roasted malty intense spices bourbon vanilla chocolate peppery. Just great.

750 ml bottle shared by bsuedekum - or was it Dak - it was one of their bottles. Thanks, guys! Pours a deep, opaque brown with a small tan head. The rum and brandy are apparent all the way through this one, with chocolate, dark fruits (fig, date, raisin), roasted malts, coconut, marshmallow, molasses, and that signature chile and cinnamon spice kick. Medium-bodied, with moderate carbonation and a rich, sweet, coating mouthfeel. Decadent. Really delicious.

Timmy coming through in the clutch! Sludge black pour with a thick brown head. Aroma is heaven, deep thick fudge, coconut, vanilla roasted malts and coffee. Flavor is similar all the way throughout. Transcendent, absolutely incredible.
Shared by OmegaX. There isnt much to say that hasnt already been said. This brew is nothing short of fantastic and I thoroughly enjoy every sip. Sticky, sweet, bold and satisfying overall. Cheers!

Bottle at the house by myself. Nose is big brandy and cinnamon notes with some dark chocolate. Flavor is brownies, cinnamon, rum and brandy. Pour is ridiculously thick and stains all glasses dark ass brown. A winner.

UPDATED: JUL 16, 2014 75cl (no wax), no mention of ABV, as Double Barrel Hunahpus Imperial Stout, new exclusive American brew Anno 2014, with cacao, cinnamon and chili peppers, from De Hopduvel Gent, very complex Stout, spicy/roasted and slightly woody/alcoholic/fruity, yet not too heavy, very balanced, cloudy, small head, top class!, yet very expensive!

Bottle at Jack is Back tasting, massive thanks to Jackl for sourceing this beast, 06/03/14.

Nose is rich chocolate, dark fruit notes, booze, molasses, coconut, spice.

Full bodied, fine carbonation, oily mouthfeel, light spice in the close.
Solid BA impy, good balance, not too hot.

text: Bottle shared thanks to Nate ! Pours a deep burnt umber color with a finger of khaki foam. Lots of complex flavors and aromas imparted by the barrels. Nice brandy fruit, cinnamon, gingerbread, coconut, spicy chocolate... all the flavors ebb and flow with a underlying complexity that is just outstanding ! Everything I hoped this beer would be and more. Delicious.

Bottle shared by tommy. Thanks bro! This was very yummy, if a bit on the sweet side. Most of the base hunahpu is hidden here amongst the awesome barrel character in which the apple brandy shines. Also a bit of the rum barrel in there with some coconut and pineapple notes. Not super well integrated between barrel and base beer as mentioned previously, but that obviously isnt what this beer is aboutI mean its called Double Barrel. Well thats what the kids were calling it. Should age well. Hope to try again down the road.

UPDATED: SEP 9, 2014 Bottle thanks to Brian. Pours a very dark brown with paperthin tan head that diminishes quickly to nothing. The aroma is strong coconut, chocolate, oak, roast, and vanilla. Thick mouthfeel with rich chocolate, coconut, sweet malts, and roast finish. Very impressive, really enjoyed this one!

UPDATED: JUN 24, 2014 Pours thick dark pitch black with he most beautiful dark cocoa cinnamon hued head. Aroma brings vanilla with smooth rum and brandy barrel sweet notes smooth in the nose, coconut as well. Flavor brings the booze so nicely (not harsh), but only after cinnamon, tame peppers smooth, rum sweetness and rich cocoa flavors on a full body, full for a barrel-aging! Maybe the best of all their barrel treatments.

UPDATED: MAR 13, 2015 HMOG 2014. Was super exciting to get to try this one. And it did not let down. Out of all the beers on this day, this one was the most in your face, complex and over-the-top flavored. The spice is only mild, but the rum and brandy are separately noticeable. Vanilla, still a hint of coffee, but just a thick crazy barrel aging. This was just one of those wow beers.

Bottle courtesy of Craig at Craigs doing a Chris O tasting, Edinburgh (ta for the beer Craig) Saturday 15th March   Pours black by christ it is oily. Mmhhh.... this is bloody good, really good, some soft coconut in mouth, lots of smooth rich chocolate and blob of vanilla, loved this.  A8 A4 T9 P4 Ov17 3.9

HMOG 2014. A definite highlight of the day. The barrels come through and the base beer is still there and it all comes together in one big, gigantic, complex drink. Still a little hot and I bet that chills out over the next year or so. Would love to try this again around that time to see how it is doing. Otherwise you get some sweet brandy and sugary rum up front. A little bit of vanilla as well. The spice comes through late in the palate from the Hunahpu base. Extra points here for complexity and bravado.

Bottle at Craigs. Pours black with a tan head. Aromas of chocolate, faint spice, light booze note, coconut and wood. Taste brings all this together. Dark chocolate taste, some roasty bitterness. Smooth, lovely.

Huge thanks to DocJ007 for sharing this one with us tonight. Happy birthday buddy!!


A - Pours jet black with a small film of tan head, quickly dissipating down to nothing at all, leaving no lace at all on the glass. Pretty much dead flat almost instantly.


S - Smells of milk chocolate, chili spices, vanilla beans, cinnamon, spicy rum and fruity brandy warmth. Everything that should be present is there and shining brightly.


T - Starts off with a mix of cinnamon and chili spices quickly being joined by the milk chocolate, vanilla and toffee sweetness. The spicy rum and fruity brandy match perfectly with the base flavors. Finish is spicy sweet with some mild booze burn, lingering long after the finish.


M - Heavy body with moderate to low carbonation. Slick, spicy feel with a bit of heat at the end of each sip. Just needs more carbonation and it would be amazing.


O - This is a pretty incredible beer. The two barrels blend very well together and complement the base flavors amazingly well. I would still take the Apple Brandy version over this one but it is closer than any of the other variants I have had to date.

Bottle, thanks Craig. Black with dark brown head. Intense aroma of chocolate and coconut. Taste of dark chocolate bounty bars. Thick and sweet. Not very complex, pretty much chocolate and coconut which is not a problem

bottle at home ... at the Lets do a Chris O tasting...dark black ... thin tan lacing ... deep dark roast ... deep malt nose ... deep dark malts ... sweet malts ... dark roast ... big coconut ... dark roast... massive malt . dark malts ,,, deep sweet chocolate and coconut roast ... cxxxxxxd3s

Huge thanks to Matt for whipping out this massive dong. Thick and black. Chocolate and cinnamon. Cinnamon covers the chilli initially. More chili as it warmed up. All mixes pretty well. Not getting any booze, maybe its just perfectly balanced. Amazing stuff.
Bottle. Black pour with tan head. Apple brandy, light rum oak, chocolate, roasted tones. Chocolate, cinnamon, light pepper, rum and oak flavors. The complex flavor is a nice blend.

Opaque black, thin brown lacing. Sweet aroma of cocoa powder, cinnamon, chillies, rum, toffee, espresso, and oak. Sticky sweet with mild spice follow through. Very slick and viscous, full bodied, and smooth. Mild to moderate booziness with a lingering sweet finish.

UPDATED: MAR 15, 2014 Black pour that's thick and leaves a nice coating along the glass. Wonderful flavors and aromas of cinnamon, dark chocolate, brandy barrel, and faint vanilla/coconut. Layer upon layer of deliciousness; chili pepper spice becomes more prominent as it warms...yum!
Holy balls, best variant of hunahpu variant ever. Incrdidbly complex flavors. The port barrels plays so nice with the chocolate chili flavors of the base beer. Perfect chili stout.
Dark brown, nearly black pour with a tan head. Aroma is brandy, spice, chocolate and taste is brandy, chocolate, peppery goodness. So very awesome, one of the best beers Ive ever had!
Pours black as hell with a typical reddish brown head. Flavors are incredible. Peppers, cinnamon, bourbon, brandy, vanilla, cocoa...just wicked shit. Fuck yeah.

6th March 2014Jack is back tasting at Bruces. Big thanks to Jack for this one. Opaque black - brown beer, small pale tan head. Palate is smooth with fine carbonation. Rich dark malt and dark chocolate. Big toasted coconut. Very light chilli itch. Mellow rum soaked dark fruits. Touch of limey/appley spice. Viscous and slightly spicy finish. Lovely!

Black with tan foam. Aroma is fruit fruit and spice. Taste is Hunahpu with a stronger maltiness or beery quality. The fruit spice is not quite as dominant. Overall lovely but still feel coffee is even better balanced with the mulled wine vibe of the original beer. Wish I had a few bottles of this one nonetheless.

UPDATED: MAR 27, 2014 On tap at Hunahpus Day 14. Sweet nose. Cinnamon and an oakiness not present in the regular versions. Apple and molasses, and I can almost separate the Rum and the Brandy. The hotness of the peppers really gets dragged down by the barrel. Really nice and drinkable.

Bottle, massive thanks to the legend that is Jack! It pours dark brown/black with a small beige head. The nose is rich roast earth, toasty, vanilla, coconut, big alcohol hit, candied fruits and milk chocolate. The taste is bitter-sweet, oily, roasted malt, wood, chocolate, warming alcohol, plum, prune, cherry and light spice with a warming finish. Full body, fine carbonation and oily mouth-feel. Rich and intense. Just a bit too hot and sweet. A very good beer anyhow, but not quite as good as some of the previous BA versions.

UPDATED: MAY 23, 2014 Pours a super thick viscous jet black color. Aroma is chocolately, some cinnamon, a little barrel vanilla and booze notes. Thick sticky mouthfeel. Chocolatey, very syrupy, light barrel notes, and cinnamon boozy. Very big flavor and tasty. Lots of Yummm.

Not a huge barrel presence, chocolate and caramel with oatmeal and chili spice.
Flavor follows and is good, but not as spiced as id like. A great beer, but not where I want it.

Bottle shared in London - huge thanks to Jack. Pours thick black-brown with a creamy tan head. Great nose, lots of milk chocolate, toasted coconut, so,e dark berries. Big sweet flavor with some lightly dried cocoa, subtle cinnamon, burnt wood, chocolate cake. Full bodied with fine carbonation. Warming finish with lots of cinnamon-laced dark chocolate, more burnt wood, dried cherries. Slight chili heat in the throat. Excellent. Great depth and intensity but still well balanced.

Thanks DmouthCaliBrewz for sharing this bottle with me. Split 4 ways (more than enough I should add) at about 55 Degrees F in snifters.

A - Pitch black, 1 finger head that fades fast. Great legs, some minor particles on the swish. Looks eerily similar to straight up regular Hunahphu. 

S - Nose WHOA. this is a different beast than its little brother. Maple, cupcake, vanilla, rocky road ice cream, the brandy sweetness definitely comes in like its 4th of July.

T - Again, shines even deeper. I would guess this is way higher than 14% ABV. Wedding Cake, brownie batter, pepper only at middle to end and doesnt linger. the spice is in no way hanging on for dear life. You get this bright maple waffles and chocolate cupcake like this is all dessert and should pair really well with NOTHING. drink it straight up after eating a steak dinner. youve deserved it!

M - Thick, velvetty, sweet and smooth. 

O - Great beer! I love it. Would get more if I could.

750ml bottle. man this was amazing. same taste as the regular huna but big barrel aroma. the rum and apple brandy have a big taste on this one compared to the cali huna. the chili is very mild. great beer

Bottle all to myself because I am a selfish bastard. This one pours pitch black, thick and inky looking, with nothing but a little rim of dark brown bubbles on top until I get a bit more aggressive, then I get a nice small dark brown head on top. Beautiful. Big time sweet cocoa aroma with apple brandy and some rum in the background, a bit of cinnamon, some light chile powder, booze, and some faint vanilla (I dont get much vanilla in the regular version anyway). Flavor is wow. Big time fudge hits you at the start, with a kick of cinnamon, vanilla, very faint chile burn on the way down. And thats just the start. There is a nutty flavor from the apple brandy that accents the cocoa and cinnamon perfectly. The rum is subdued, which I am glad about, but adds a subtle extra sweetness and spice, similar to what I got from Forgotten Island. The melody of flavors in this come together almost as well as Founders CBS. This has a thick viscous body as expected from CCB, with low carbonation (but more than Cali Brandy). It goes down incredibly easy relative to Cali as well. The spices really offset the sweetness nicely and make this a pretty amazing offering. To be honest, I came into this expecting some disappointment after Cali Brandy. This is a completely different beer. Wow.

Bottle shared by madbeerbaron...thanks Ben! - Pours dark black, with a ring of brown head. Nose is cinnamon graham cracker, vanilla, chocolate and a bit of chile heat. Taste is more cinnamon graham crackers, nice chile heat, subtle with chocolate sweet malt. Thick and slick body. Very tasty, even though Im not a huge imperial stout fan.

@ Stogies and Stouts 2014. a marked improvement over regular Huna, also shows that maybe its best to drink Huna fresh. seems the older it gets, the worse it gets. but this one is the best variation ive had so far.

Bottle shared by Darkguardian. Joan Jett black pour with a chocolate head. Mild chili and cinnamon aromas. A little thinner in the body than previous treatments I believe, but still fantastic with a beautiful oily sheen. Outstanding with big chili, pronounced cinnamon, vanilla, coconut, and dark roasted malt highlights. Mellow brandy, rum, and oak lowlights. Absolutely fabulous. Excellent mouthfeel.

Bottle - I get an oaky afterbirth in the nose. Lots of coconut, chocolate, and cinnamon in the nose. Very thick and viscous. Tastes of chili peppers, vanilla, cinnamon, toasted coconut, and dark bitter chocolate. Freakishly solid!!!

I dont have the best nose (been punched too many times), so I couldnt tell you every little flavor that comes out in this amazing Imperial Stout. But its definitely chocolaty and boozy with almost no carbonation. Its got just the right touch of sweetness and pours like fresh oil being put into your car. It has that distinct Hunahpu bitterness to it, which is reminiscent of any imperial stout, but as CCB can only do. We were limited to 2 glasses per person (special Valentines Day tap), which was easily understandable as after 1 glass I was feeling all warm and fuzzy. For me, its hard to say whether I would choose this over the regular treatment (and cant compare to the Brandy Barrel Aged treatment since Ive never had it). Its a similar taste and mouthfeel compared to the Goose Island Bourbon County Bourbon Stout and it had no lacing on the glass, but was good and sticky sweet. I would definitely put this on the list for Hunahpus Day this year as one of the beers you need to try if you havent had it yet.
